instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running on charger
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wich is running on a charged battery.
It is not running/charging with the original charger (85W).
On my laboratory power supply with 19V it's charging and running.

When i plug in the charger the first time, green light is flashing one time - then nothing (no green, no orange)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> goes up to 12.4V and is then falling down to 2V (naked board, original charger 85W)
There is Data-Communication on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> and  <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL>

Can you give me help for further troubleshooting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running on charger
threads.message:
Looks like input leakage.
Original charger is smart enough to detect it and get blocked.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> are the first suspects; sometime may be <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages, with the lab PSU connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running on charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running on charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running on charger
threads.message:
Changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> did help.
Thank you so much ;-)
